org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.mxml

Class MXMLTagData

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flex.compiler.common.SourceLocation
      • org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.mxml.MXMLUnitData
        • org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.mxml.MXMLTagData
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISourceLocation, IMXMLTagData, IMXMLUnitData

    public class MXMLTagData
extends MXMLUnitData
implements IMXMLTagData
    Encapsulation of an open tag, a close tag, or an empty tag in MXML.

    • Field Summary

      int getContentStart()
      Returns the first character of the actual content of the unit For most units this is the same as getStart(), but for things like tags which have "junk punctuation" around them, SourceLocation.getAbsoluteStart() will return the junk punctuation, whereas getContentStart will get the content inside the punctuation.

    • Method Detail

      • getContentStart

        public int getContentStart()
        Description copied from interface: IMXMLUnitData
        Returns the first character of the actual content of the unit For most units this is the same as getStart(), but for things like tags which have "junk punctuation" around them, SourceLocation.getAbsoluteStart() will return the junk punctuation, whereas getContentStart will get the content inside the punctuation.
        Specified by:
        getContentStart in interface IMXMLUnitData
        Overrides:
        getContentStart in class MXMLUnitData

      • getContentEnd

        public int getContentEnd()
        Description copied from interface: IMXMLUnitData
        Returns the offset after the last character of actual content. See IMXMLUnitData.getContentStart() for more.
        Specified by:
        getContentEnd in interface IMXMLUnitData
        Overrides:
        getContentEnd in class MXMLUnitData

      • containsOffset

        public boolean containsOffset(int offset)
        For tags, we "contain" an offset if our content contains the offset. This means that we return false for the outside "<", ">", ""
        Specified by:
        containsOffset in interface IMXMLUnitData
        Overrides:
        containsOffset in class MXMLUnitData
        Returns:
        true if the offset falls within this unit's bounds.

        Collect the text contents of this tag (like or )

      • getCompilableText

        public String getCompilableText()
        Description copied from interface: IMXMLTagData
        Gets this compilable text inside this tag. The compilable text may appear as multiple child text units, and there may also be comments (which are ignored). If any child units are tags rather than text, they are simply ignored.
        Specified by:
        getCompilableText in interface IMXMLTagData
        Returns:
        The compilable text inside this tag.

      • findMatchingEndTag

        public IMXMLTagData findMatchingEndTag()
        Description copied from interface: IMXMLTagData
        Finds the close tag that matches this tag.

        Returns null if this tag is a close or empty tag.

        Returns null if a surrounding tag is unbalanced; this is determined by backing up to the innermost parent tag with a different tag.

        <a> <b> <b> <-- find matching for this one will return null </b> </a> *

        Specified by:
        findMatchingEndTag in interface IMXMLTagData

      • findMatchingEndTag

        public IMXMLTagData findMatchingEndTag(boolean includeImplicit)
        Finds the close tag that matches this tag.

        Returns null if this tag is a close or empty tag.

        Returns null if a surrounding tag is unbalanced ONLY if includeImplicit is false; this is determined by backing up to the innermost parent tag with a different tag.

        <a> <b> <b> <-- find matching for this one will return null </b> </a> *

      • isImplicit

        public boolean isImplicit()
        Description copied from interface: IMXMLTagData
        Determines whether this tag does not actually exist within the MXML document that is its source.
        Specified by:
        isImplicit in interface IMXMLTagData
        Returns:
        true if this tag is implicit.

      • hasEndTag

        public boolean hasEndTag()
        determines if the current tag has an end tag. Will return true if this tag is a close tag or an end tag. If the document is not balanced, we will return false. If the end tag was implicit, we will return false
        Returns:
        true if this tag has an end tag

      • getFirstChildUnit

        public IMXMLUnitData getFirstChildUnit()
        Description copied from interface: IMXMLTagData
        Gets the first child unit inside this tag.

        The child unit may be a tag or text. If there is no child unit, this method returns null.

        Specified by:
        getFirstChildUnit in interface IMXMLTagData
        Returns:
        The first child unit inside this tag.

      • getFirstChild

        public IMXMLTagData getFirstChild(boolean includeEmptyTags)
        Description copied from interface: IMXMLTagData
        Gets the first child open tag of this tag.

        "First child" means the first open (or maybe empty) tag found before a close tag. If this is a close tag, this method starts looking after the corresponding start tag.

        Specified by:
        getFirstChild in interface IMXMLTagData
        Returns:
        Child tag, or null if none.

      • getNextSibling

        public IMXMLTagData getNextSibling(boolean includeEmptyTags)
        Description copied from interface: IMXMLTagData
        Gets the next sibling open tag of this tag.

        "Sibling" is defined as the first open (or maybe empty) tag after this tag's close tag. If this is a close tag, this method starts looking after the corresponding start tag.

        Specified by:
        getNextSibling in interface IMXMLTagData
        Returns:
        Sibling, or null if none.

      • getChildren

        public IMXMLTagData[] getChildren(boolean includeEmptyTags)
        Get the start tags for all children of this tag.
        Parameters:
        includeEmptyTags - true if empty tags should be included.
        Returns:
        Array of children.

      • getParentTag

        public IMXMLTagData getParentTag()
        Return the parent tag of this tag. If the document is not balanced before this tag, returns null.
        Specified by:
        getParentTag in interface IMXMLTagData
        Returns:
        An IMXMLTagData object.

        public ISourceLocation getLocationOfChildUnits()
        Description copied from interface: IMXMLTagData

        Specified by:
        getLocationOfChildUnits in interface IMXMLTagData
        Returns:
        A source location.

      • verify

        public boolean verify()
        Verifies that this tag and its attributes have their source location information set.

        This is used only in asserts.

        Overrides:
